channel.title: Tech Paper: Double Counting
channel.description:
IATI is a publishing standard which encourages **all** actors in the development and humanitarian aid delivery chains to publish information on their activities and finances. As a result you can't simply add up all the numbers. Many users of the data need, somehow, to derive meaningful totals.
* What rules do individual publishers need to follow within their own reporting? * Traceability of finances down the delivery chain provides a means of avoiding double counting. We need to be clear on the rules for publishers and users alike. * Given that many publishers will take a long time to properly implement traceability - **particularly through multilaterals** - is there a simpler methodology that could be used to assist data users?
[This paper](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FN-R2mwSqPrTJElkjiWkyqrOAu-SIG6jeo_4LqJy_Ow/edit?usp=sharing) is part of the [Agenda](http://discuss.iatistandard.org/t/tag-tech-consult-outline-agenda/534) for the IATI TAG 2016 [Technical Consultation Workshop](http://discuss.iatistandard.org/t/technical-consultation-workshop/533)
